attributes.action: All MPs should give their 11% pay rise to support a charity in their consistency for the term of the next government.
attributes.additional_details:
Setting aside all discussion on who sets MPs salary you would expect every MP to accept that a 11% pay rise is morally wrong and is not representative of their consistency.

I would like to have a cross party agreement that ALL MPs give 10% of their pay rise to a charity in their consistency every year for the 5year length of the next parliament.

A pensioner gets a MAXIMUM of £5727.80 a year, the comparison with a £7,600 pay rise for MPs is a disgrace.
